bioghist.p: The Home for Friendless and Destitute Children was founded in November 1863 as a charitable organization for orphans and children whose families were unable to support them, usually dependents of soldiers serving in the Civil War. The Home was established by prominent citizens of Wilmington, Delaware, and the surrounding area who set up various boards to regulate and supervise the Home's dormitories and activities. In 1938 the name of the Home was changed to Children's Home, Inc., under which it still operates.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the records of the Board of Managers of the Home for Friendless and Destitute Children. Materials include: minutes of the Household, Finance, Admissions and Dismission, and Executive committees and the Board of Trustees; summaries of minutes; correspondence; financial reports; director's reports; and reports on child welfare. The collection also contains notes by Mary Morris, who was working on a history of the Home.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
